posts.author: blur927
posts.content:
Hey guys,

I'm trying to build out a melee mage concept and would like your help. I've read HipMaestro's melee mage thread and thought it sounded like a lot of fun. The server I'm trying to build for is Anphillia: 
http://anphillia.pw/w/index.php/Mechanics_changes

The level cap is 16, and the server itself is pretty difficult. Rest times are once every 20-30 minutes I think so that might make things
tricky at earlier levels, but most of the time you're playing with team mates so I can fall back as a buffbot / support character.

Anyway, here is what I have so far:

Human Wizard

Illusionist 16

Str: 16
Dex: 12
Con: 14
Int: 16 (20)
Wis: 8
Cha: 8

01: Illusionist: Martial Weapon Proficiency, Toughness
02: Illusionist 
03: Illusionist: Blind Fight
04: Illusionist 
05: Illusionist: Extend Spell
06: Illusionist:  Knockdown
07: Illusionist 
08: Illusionist 
09: Illusionist: Expertise
10: Illusionist: Empower Spell
11: Illusionist 
12: Illusionist: Improved Expertise
13: Illusionist 
14: Illusionist 
15: Illusionist: Maximize Spell
16: Illusionist 

Skills would be concentration, heal, tumble, spellcraft and discipline

The main plan would be buff up myself and any teammates or a summon and go in with a greatsword. I'm not sure I need expertise with DR and concealment, but I'll have pretty low AC in robes otherwise and if I get focused on I imagine stoneskins etc dropping pretty fast. 

What do you guys think?

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
Hm, what about illusionist(15)/fighter(1)?

You can then wear full plate which will give you +8AC and cast your combat spells stilled. You lose almost nothing from your wizard powers but you gain a lot of martial prowess instead. When you are out of combat (pre-buffing) you can be without it and cast your spells extended/empowered but when in combat you can cast them stilled. 


Human Illusionist(15)/ Fighter(1)

Str:   16 (18)
Dex:   8
Con: 16
Int:    16 (18)
Wis:    8
Cha:   8

01: Fighter(01): WF: Greatsword, Expertise, Toughness
02: Illusionist(01): Scribe Scroll, Pixie Familiar
03: Illusionist(02): Blind-Fight
04: Illusionist(03): {INT +1}
05: Illusionist(04):
06: Illusionist(05): Still Spell, Knockdown
07: Illusionist(06):
08: Illusionist(07): {INT +1}
09: Illusionist(08): Extend Spell
10: Illusionist(09):
11: Illusionist(10): Empower Spell
12: Illusionist(11): Improved Knockdown, {STR +1}
13: Illusionist(12):
14: Illusionist(13):
15: Illusionist(14): Improved Critical: Greatsword
16: Illusionist(15): Maximize Spell, {STR +1}

*You can opt to take Dwarf instead and gain darkvision, +1 fortitude & the other Dwarven bonuses at no loss.
 To do that, simply get rid of "toughness" and instead start with Constitution(18).

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
blur927 wrote: Ooh I like the dip into fighter. Saves a feat and gives me the option of using a sword and board if necessary.

Do you think my AB will be high enough outside of Tenser's windows? It is pretty important to reliably hit around 35 AC-ish creatures if melee damage is going to be my main source, so around 25 ab would be the goal
The AB at lvl 16 will be 20-21 with empowered Bull's and GMW. You also have short bursts of True strike.
But the idea of the melee mage is to melee the mooks and save the spells for the bosses.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content:
You can do 25 AB aye, but this is not the way of the war-mage. Instead, throw a stilled Bigby's VI or VII to the boss to completely neutralize it and then let the warriors finish it off while you observe the battlefield. If the boss is somehow immune to those OP spells then shrug and just choke it to death with Isaack's greater missile storms till he is nothing but a smear on the ground. Wizards are so overpowered that is not even funny to mention it. War-wizards that can also take a big two-hander and start chopping on their own, and then can pick every lock and disarm every trap with their familiar...But yes, it is preferable to simply use your melee prowess for the mobs conserving your "big spells" for the tough encounters, that give your party a hard time. You will be invaluable to your party and also capable of soloing on your own should you need to.

As to how you can have 25 AB from just 8 BAB...
AB: 8(bab) +4(18 str) +5(gmw) +3(emp. bull's) +3(belt+gloves of str) +2 (aid+bless pots).
Throw in an extended haste & keen edge + flame weapon & you will hit like a truck with your greatsword.

Have fun with your war-wizard ;)

Mick Dagger wrote: But the idea of the melee mage is to melee the mooks and save the spells for the bosses.
And don't forget as a mage you have free access to scribe scroll.  So before you rest, scribe the leftover spells to scrolls and slowly build up an arsenal for when times get tough or your almost out of spells.
